agency_desc: Fiscal officer of the county who maintains property records for Steuben County.
service_description: Coordinates various tax functions for Steuben County and maintains recordkeeping for the County Council.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Steuben County

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the town of Fremont in Steuben County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the town of Fremont in Steuben County. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the town of Fremont in Steuben County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Steuben County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Fremont in Steuben County.

site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Steuben County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Fremont in Steuben County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a resident library card: Living in Millgrove Township

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Send an email, call, or walk in for more information or to request assistance.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing an educational learning environment for adults and youth to enhance literacy and productivity of students.
service_description: Provides homework help, tutoring and instruction for all skill levels. Transportation is provided at no charge to participants (not available at Hamilton).
site_details: Call or visit the website to complete the registration form.
site_eligibility: Living in Fremont and Hamilton Community School districts in Steuben County -- Grades K-8 (home-school students welcomed)

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency serving families with limited resources by offering case management, food distribution, and a thrift shop for clothing, furniture, and household supplies at a reduced price.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to individuals and families in need. Visits are limited to once per month. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received food from this pantry in the past 30 days

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency that provides healthcare to those in need.
service_description: Offers a primary care free clinic for uninsured patients living in Steuben County. Basic lab testing may be provided. Referrals for specialized care (including dental services, X-rays, surgery, physical therapy, gynecology, and mental health services) may also be provided.
site_details: Call and leave a message to request an appointment. -- Walk-ins accepted around 4:30pm for patients without an appointment; first-come, first-served.
site_eligibility: With household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Uninsured and not eligible for Medicaid or Medicare

agency_desc: Northeastern Center helps individuals in northeastern Indiana achieve emotional and mental wholeness through accessible, affordable and quality behavioral health services.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - STEUBEN COUNTY
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anxiety, bi-polar disorder, depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), panic disorder, personality disorder, or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in during designated hour or call the office for information or to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization in northern Indiana that provides transitional living for women seeking sobriety from drugs and alcohol and to regain healthier lifestyles.
service_description: Provides transitional living for women recovering from chemical dependency to drugs or alcohol. Residents must attend 12-Step meetings, secure employment, maintain house chores, and commit to sobriety. Length of stay is nine months.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to request an application. Forms may be downloaded from the website.

site_schedule.name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services

site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Sober 72 hours prior to admittance -- Willing to commit to program rules

agency_name: COMPASSION PREGNANCY CENTERS OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit, pro-life organization that offers maternity outreach, parenting education, and material support to pregnant women and women with young children.
site_name: COMPASSION PREGNANCY CENTERS OF NORTHEAST INDIANA - ANGOLA
service_description: Provides an incentive program that encourages pregnant women and new mothers and fathers to access parenting education, health care, and related services. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed for maternity and baby supplies such as diapers, infant and toddler clothing, maternity clothing, and cribs.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, mothers, fathers with children up to age 3
Pregnant women or mothers with children up to age 3

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office or Steuben County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Age 3-5 years-old (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% of the Federal Poverty Level
Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides advocacy and services for older adults to promote independence and enhance well-being. Operates public transportation.
service_description: Offers public, curb-to-curb transportation throughout Steuben County. All rides are required to be scheduled in advance. Wheelchair-accessible vans available.
site_details: Walk in, call, or email to schedule a reservation for a ride; first-come, first-served.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides planning and zoning for Steuben County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Steuben County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property and abandoned vehicles, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call for information, to make a report, or submit a complaint.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Steuben County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing a homeless shelter.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for homeless people and families in Steuben County and surrounding areas. Case management services, including assistance with finding employment, and long-term housing, parenting, nutrition and budget classes are provided to shelter residents. Maximum length of stay is limited to 60 days.
site_details: Call to check on availability and to request an interview.
site_eligibility: Homeless men, women, and married couples with or without children -- Without a sexual or violent offense conviction

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Fremont, Jamestown, and Clear Lake townships in Steuben County. agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs in Steuben County.
service_description: Maintains and operates two public housing complexes (Elliot Manor and Northlake Manor) for low-income families, seniors, and persons with disabilities in Steuben County. Application required; wait list may apply. Rent is calculated as percentage of monthly adjusted income.
site_details:
? Visit the website [https://bit.ly/AHA_FullApp] to download and print application. 
? Submit completed application and all required documents by postal mail, email, fax, or office drop box.
? Staff will review materials and reach out to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: US citizens and eligible immigrants living in Steuben County -- Household income at or below 80% of area median income -- With satisfactory criminal history as determined by assessment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing nutritious meals to persons who are homebound, ill, or disabled who are unable to prepare meals.
service_description: Delivers hot, midday meals each weekday to homebound persons in need. Offers a variety of meals based on dietary needs.
site_details: Call for information or to request services.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Angola in Steuben County -- Age 50 or older -- Persons with a disability -- Unable to prepare meals

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.

agency_desc: A nonprofit clinic providing medical, dental, and vision care for children from newborn to age 18 in Steuben County.
service_description: Provides free preventive dental, vision, and physical exams for children up to age 18. If exam requires further treatment, agency will refer to the appropriate medical office. Financial assistance is offered to help pay for treatment, if needed. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment (preferred); walk-ins are accepted.
site_eligibility: Living in Steuben County -- Newborns to youth age 18

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Steuben County.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to Steuben County persons in need, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Walk in to request one.
site_eligibility: Open
Open; serves Steuben County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Steuben County.

site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
Traffic tickets issued in Steuben County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Steuben County, Magistrate Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Steuben County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Steuben County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Steuben County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Steuben County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.

service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: County department that answers the dispatch calls for all fire, police and medical assistance in Steuben County, excluding Angola City Police and Fire Department.
service_description: Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Steuben County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the 24-hour, nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Steuben County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers long-term shelter and support services for women and children who are fleeing domestic violence.
service_description: Provides shelter for women (with or without children) who are victims of domestic violence or sexual assault. Support services include case management, domestic abuse counseling, life-skills coaching, and employment information. Women may access child care services up to six months after leaving the shelter. Limited transportation may be available on a case by case basis. Length of stay ranges between 6 to 18 months.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment; after-hours leave a message for a return call.
site_eligibility: Women with or without children (up to age 12) -- Fleeing domestic violence or victims of sexual assault -- Sober 72 hours prior to admission

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Angola in Steuben County.
service_description: Provides free smoke detectors to households in need, in the city of Angola in Steuben County, when funds are available.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to download the application. A fireman will schedule a time to visit the home and install the smoke detector.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Angola in Steuben County -- Homeowners -- In financial need
Open; Responds to emergency situations in the city of Angola in Steuben County

agency_name: COMMUNITY HUMANE SHELTER OF STEUBEN COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers animal care services and shelter for surrendered or abandoned animals.
site_name: COMMUNITY HUMANE SHELTER OF STEUBEN COUNTY
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals in Steuben County and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services and microchipping of pets. Issues pet licenses for Steuben County.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and assesses all real estate properties in Steuben County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all real estate properties in Steuben County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Steuben County

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in Steuben County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in Steuben County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A member corporation that provides electric service for rural customers.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Steuben County and portions of Lagrange and DeKalb counties.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone. -- Drop box is available at this location.

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Providers
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Cahoots Mission is "to provide a safe space for youth to thrive."
service_description: Provides an after-school enrichment program with recreational activities for area youth. Services include homework help, arts and crafts, entertainment, mentoring, educational workshops, and referrals to other social services.
site_details: Walk in, visit the website, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 and under

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Steuben County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am-noon

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am-noon

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A non profit organization with charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, meat, and bread to people in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open
